data.name: EDIFACT_DOWNLOADER_USAGE
data.value: Usage: {0} ARGS ARGS: /m, --message {{MESSAGE|#}} - message type (# for no message, all messages if omitted) /d, --directories LIST - message directory(ies) divided with commas and minuses for intervals (for example: "D97B,D10A-D11B") /n, --ns NS - EDIFACT namespace substitution /t, --target-folder PATH - target folder where schemas will be placed --tmp-folder PATH - temporary folder /p, --proxy http[s]://[USER[:PASSWORD]@]ADDRESS:PORT - use proxy for download --connection-timeout SECONDS - connection timeout of web client

data.name: URI_SCHEME_NOT_SUPPORTED
data.value: Uri scheme is not supported: '{0}'.

data.name: PARSER_CLI_USAGE
data.value:
Usage: {0} OPTIONS
where OPTIONS: --{1} URI (Mandatory) The root folder URI where EDIFACT Xml-schemas are placed.
--{2} URI (Mandatory) The URI of input EDIFACT interchange file.
--{3} URI (Mandatory) The URI of output folder, where message Xml-files will be placed.
--{4} "<Type1>=<suffix1>;..." (Optional) List of type=suffix pairs separated with semicolon (;) of EDIFACT messages Xml-schemas files to use instead of original ones.
--{5} ENCODING (Optional) Encoding name to use when failed to extract from data.
--{6} yes|no (Optional, default yes) Allows to check EDIFACT data a bit less strictly.
--{7} SIZE (Optional) Internal buffer size for possible optimization.
